title: Transaction Set Summary
description: An outline of all required components for an EDI transaction set implementation.

code.description: A short code identifying the Transaction Set.

name.description: A descriptive name for the Transaction Set.

functional_group.description: Haven't figured out the purpose of this yet.

components.description: The components that make up the Transaction Set.

loop_summary.description: A repeated collection of Segments and/or other Loops. Used in Companion Guides.

loop_id.description: A unique string used to identify the Loop within its Transaction Set.

repeat.description: Number of times a particular Loop may be repeated.

loop.description: Loop in which the Loop appears.

level.description: Indicates where the Loop is located in the Transaction Set.

req.description: Defines if/how the Loop is required.

components.description: A List of `segment_summary`s for the Segments present in the Loop.

segment_summary.description: A collection of Data Elements. Used in Companion Guides to define a Transaction Set.

pos.description: Indicates the order in which Segments should appear in their Level of the Transaction Set.

purpose.description: Documents the purpose of a Segment.

max_use.description: Number of times a particular Segment may be repeated at its location in the Transaction Set.

usage.description: Indicates whether or not the Segment must be used; Somewhat redundant due to `Req`.

loop.description: Loop in which the Segment appears.

element_count.description: Number of Data Elements included in the Segment.

req.description: Defines if/how the Segment is required.

level.description: Indicates where the Segment is located in the Transaction Set.

elements.description: Number of Data Elements included in the Segment.

element_summary.description: An individual EDI Data Element. Used in Companion Guides to define requirements for a Segment.

ref.description: Indicates the order in which Elements should appear in their Segment.

id.description: Short string used to identify the Element.

min.description: Minimum length for a valid Element value. Used for validation.

max.description: Maximum length for a valid Element value. Used for validation.

req.description: Defines if/how the Element is required.

usage.description: Indicates whether or not the Element must contain a value; Somewhat redundant due to `Req`.

valid_values.description: A list of valid values for the Element.

type.description: The kind of value the Element will contain.
